intro: Nestronia quadriata, commonly known as the four-leaf nestronia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features include four-lobed leaves and a unique, fragrant floral structure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
